title: Regular polytopes of rank $n/2$ for transitive groups of degree $n$
authors: Maria Elisa Fernandes and Claudio Alexandre Piedade
abstract:
Previous research established that the maximal rank of the abstract regular
polytopes whose automorphism group is a transitive proper subgroup of $\Sym_n$
is $n/2 + 1$, with only two polytopes attaining this rank, both of which having
odd ranks.
  In this paper, we investigate the case where the rank is equal to $n/2$
($n\geq 14$). Our analysis reveals that reducing the rank by one results in a
substantial increase in the number of regular polytopes ($33$ distinct families
are discovered) covering all possible ranks (even and odd).
